messages.content:
आपल्या प्रश्नानुसार, "13.40.13" मध्ये घटक म्हणजेच नत्र (N), फॉस्फरस (P), आणि पोटॅशियम (K) यांचे प्रमाण आहे. 

- **नत्र (N)**: 13% 
- **फॉस्फरस (P)**: 40% 
- **पोटॅशियम (K)**: 13%

हे प्रमाण सामान्यतः खतांमध्ये आढळते आणि पिकांच्या वाढीसाठी आवश्यक असलेल्या पोषण घटकांचे प्रतिनिधित्व करते.
messages.en:
According to your question, "13.40.13" contains the amount of elements i.e. Pot (N), Phosphorus (P), and Potassium (K). 

- Natra (N): 13% 
- Phosphorus (P): 40% 
- Potassium (K): 13%

This quantity is commonly found in khatans and represents the nutritional components needed for the growth of the crops.

- **फॉस्फरस (P)**: 19%

- Natra (N): 19%
- Phosphorus (P): 19%
- Potassium (K): 0%

This means that the amount of nutrients and phosphorus in this account is the same, but potassium is not. This letter is generally useful for the initial growth of crops.

messages.content:

- **नत्र (N)**: 12%

messages.en:
"12-61-00" contains elements such as nitrogen (N), phosphorus (P), and potassium (K).

- **Nitrogen (N)**: 12%
- **Phosphorus (P)**: 61%
- **Potassium (K)**: 0%

This means that this fertilizer is low in nitrogen, high in phosphorus, and no potassium. This fertilizer is generally useful for phosphorus requirements, especially in the early growth phase of crops.

messages.content: कॅलिब्रेट किती तासात होते
messages.en: how many hours was calibrated
messages.standalone_question: How many hours does calibration take?
messages.standalone_en: How many hours does calibration take?

messages.content: सामान्यतः, मातीच्या आर्द्रता संवेदकांचे कॅलिब्रेशन करण्यासाठी 12 तास लागतात. यामध्ये, तुम्ही पाण्याची सिंचन केल्यानंतर 12 तासांची प्रतीक्षा करावी लागेल, जेणेकरून पाणी संवेदकापर्यंत पोहोचेल आणि मातीची आर्द्रता योग्यरित्या मोजली जाईल.
messages.en: Typically, it takes 12 hours to calibrate soil moisture sensors. In this, you will have to wait 12 hours after irrigating the water, so that the water reaches the sensor and soil moisture is properly measured.

messages.content: डिवाइस बसवलेला 24 तास झाले
messages.en: It's been 24 hours since the device was installed
messages.standalone_question: How long has the device been installed?
messages.standalone_en: How long has the device been installed?

messages.content:
जर तुम्ही डिवाइस बसवलेले 24 तास झाले असतील आणि तरीही मातीची आर्द्रता संवेदक "कोरडे" दर्शवत असेल, तर काही कारणे असू शकतात:

1. **पाणी संवेदकापर्यंत पोहोचत नाही**: पाण्याचा प्रवाह योग्यरित्या होत नाही, ज्यामुळे संवेदकांपर्यंत पाणी पोहोचत नाही. कृपया तपासा की ड्रिप सिस्टीम व्यवस्थित कार्यरत आहे का.

2. **ड्रिप ब्लॉक झालेले**: ड्रिपर ब्लॉक झाले असल्यास, पाणी योग्य ठिकाणी पोहोचत नाही. 

3. **संपूर्ण माती भिजलेली नाही**: जर ड्रिपर संवेदकांच्या जवळ नसतील, तर पाणी संवेदकांपर्यंत पोहोचत नाही.

4. **संवेदक जुना आहे**: जर संवेदक 2 वर्षांपेक्षा जुना असेल, तर तो खराब होऊ शकतो.

तुम्हाला यापैकी कोणतेही कारण तपासायचे आहे का? किंवा तुम्हाला सपोर्ट तिकीट उघडायचे आहे का?
messages.en:
If it's been 24 hours since you installed the device and the soil moisture sensor still shows "dry," there may be a few reasons:

1. **Water does not reach the sensor**: Water does not flow properly, due to which water does not reach the sensors. Please check if the drip system is working properly.

2. **Drip blocked**: If the dripper is blocked, the water does not reach the right place. 

3. **The whole soil is not soaked**: If the dripers are not close to the sensors, the water does not reach the sensors.

4. **The sensor is old**: If the sensor is older than 2 years, it can deteriorate.

Do you want to check any of these causes? Or do you want to open a support ticket?

21. **Early Blight** (अर्ली ब्लाइट)
22. **Fruit Canker** (फळ कँकर)

33. **Rice Blast** (राईस ब्लास्ट)
34. **Root Knot Nematode** (रूट नॉट नेमाटोड)
35. **Rust** (रस्ट)
36. **Scab** (स्कॅब)
37. **Sheath Blight** (शिअथ बुरशी)
38. **Sigatoka Leaf Spot** (सिगाटोका पान धब्बा)
39. **Stylar End Rot** (स्टायलर एंड रॉट)
40. **Whip Smut** (व्हिप स्मट)
41. **Xanthomonas** (झॅन्थोमोनस)
42. **Yellow Rust** (येलो रस्ट)

messages.content:
आपल्या दिलेल्या चित्रात बाणानाच्या बागेतील एक मॉनिटरिंग डिवाइस दिसत आहे, परंतु फसलाच्या आरोग्याची स्थिती किंवा कोणत्याही रोग किंवा कीडांच्या लक्षणांचे स्पष्ट चित्रण केलेले नाही.

अधिक अचूक विश्लेषणासाठी, कृपया बाणानाच्या पानांचे जवळचे फोटो घ्या, ज्यामध्ये कोणत्याही विशिष्ट क्षेत्रांवर लक्ष केंद्रित केले जाईल, ज्या ठिकाणी रंग बदल, ठिपके, किंवा मुरझा यासारख्या लक्षणे दिसू शकतात. चांगल्या फोटोसाठी, स्पष्टता आणि जवळून घेतलेले चित्र आवश्यक आहे.
messages.en:
Your given picture shows a monitoring device in the garden of Banana, but does not clearly depict the health status of the crop or the symptoms of any disease or pest.

For a more accurate analysis, please take a close-up photo of the leaves of the banyan, which will focus on any specific areas, where symptoms such as color changes, patches, or mold may appear. For a good photo, clarity and a closely drawn picture are essential.

tools:
get_fertigation_schedule  
Checks the farmer's crop stages and requirements with internal petiole reports and gives the current week fertigation schedule details, and details of the next fertigation schedule (could be next week in the same crop stage or in next crop stage) for the plots. Fertilizers are given by 3 distribution methods:  
- Fertigation: fertilizers put into the irrigation pipeline itself  
- Foliar: on the leaves using a foliar spray  
- Soil: directly on the soil  
If the unit of fertilizer amount includes "per acre", then it is for 1 acre. Otherwise it is for "units per 1 plant".

get_specific_fertigation_requirements  
Finds the fertigation requirements for the plots with a particular crop stage and week numbers.
faq:
Q: What should I do if I can't find the fertigation schedule after selecting the fertigation tab?
A: If you don't see the fertigation schedule, you'll need to create a report first. Would you like assistance in creating a report? Do you have any soil, leaf, or petiole test data available? If not, we can generate a basic schedule for you using general crop and regional data.

Q: If I don't add any test data, what is the basis for the generated fertigation schedule?
A: When no specific test data is provided, Fyllo generates a basic fertigation schedule based on:

    1. Typical nutrient needs for your crop type
    2. General soil characteristics common in your region
    3. Standard growing practices for your area
    This schedule provides a starting point, but may not be as precise as one based on specific test data.

Q: Can I generate a fertigation schedule without soil, leaf, or petiole data?
A: Yes, you can generate a basic fertigation schedule without specific soil, leaf, or petiole data. Fyllo will create a general schedule based on typical crop needs and soil types for your region.

Q: Does Fyllo provide a fertigation schedule?
A: Yes, Fyllo provides a fertigation schedule for users.

Q: Where can I find the fertigation schedule in the Fyllo app?
A: To access the fertigation schedule:
    1. Open the Fyllo app
    2. Select "My Farm" at the bottom
    3. Tap on the "Fertigation" option
   You'll find the fertigation schedule there, including details about the required fertilizer applications.

A: To access the fertigation schedule:
    1. Open the Fyllo app

A: Fyllo's fertigation schedule is scientifically developed and validated based on crop requirements. It takes into account factors such as crop variety, growth stage, soil conditions, and available nutrient data from soil, leaf, or petiole tests when available.

आपल्या मातीच्या आर्द्रता संवेदकाचे कॅलिब्रेशन झालेले नाही असे दिसते. 0 kPa वाचन म्हणजे माती ओलसर आहे, परंतु जर हे दीर्घकाळ चालू असेल तर काही कारणे असू शकतात:

1. **नवीन स्थापना**: जर संवेदक नवीन असेल, तर त्याच्या आसपास पाण्याचे थेंब असू शकतात. यासाठी, कृपया आपल्या पूर्वीच्या शेड्यूलनुसार 3 वेळा पाणी द्या, त्यामुळे संवेदक योग्यरित्या सेट होईल.

2. **पिकाची अवस्था**: जर पिकाची अवस्था खूप लहान असेल किंवा नुकतीच छाटणी केली असेल, तर पाण्याचा शोषण कमी असतो. यासाठी, कृपया थोडा वेळ थांबा.

3. **स्थानिक भूप्रदेश**: संवेदकाच्या आजूबाजूला पाणी जमा होऊ शकते. कृपया संवेदकाच्या आजूबाजूला तपासा.

आपण या समस्येसाठी एक समर्थन तिकीट तयार करू इच्छिता का?
messages.en:
Our soil's moisture sensor doesn't seem to have calibrated. A 0 kPa reading means the soil is moist, but if it's going on for a long time, there may be some reasons:

1. **New installation**: If the sensor is new, there may be water droplets around it. For this, please water 3 times according to your previous schedule, so that the sensor will be set properly.

2. **Crop stage**: If the crop stage is too small or has just been pruned, water absorption is low. For this, please wait a while.

3. **Local terrain**: Water may accumulate around the sensor. Please check around the sensor.

Would you like to create a support ticket for this issue?

tools:
get_fertigation_schedule  
Checks the farmer's crop stages and requirements with internal petiole reports and gives the current week fertigation schedule details, and details of the next fertigation schedule (could be next week in the same crop stage or in next crop stage) for the plots. Fertilizers are given by 3 distribution methods:  
- Fertigation: fertilizers put into the irrigation pipeline itself  
- Foliar: on the leaves using a foliar spray  
- Soil: directly on the soil  
If the unit of fertilizer amount includes "per acre", then it is for 1 acre. Otherwise it is for "units per 1 plant".

get_specific_fertigation_requirements  
Finds the fertigation requirements for the plots with a particular crop stage and week numbers.
faq:
Q: What should I do if I can't find the fertigation schedule after selecting the fertigation tab?
A: If you don't see the fertigation schedule, you'll need to create a report first. Would you like assistance in creating a report? Do you have any soil, leaf, or petiole test data available? If not, we can generate a basic schedule for you using general crop and regional data.

Q: What are the advantages of adding soil, leaf, or petiole test reports?
A: By adding test reports, Fyllo can generate a more precise fertigation schedule tailored to your specific conditions. Benefits include:

    1. More accurate nutrient recommendations
    2. Better alignment with your crop's actual needs
    3. Potential for improved crop health and yield
    4. More efficient use of fertilizers
    5. Possible reduction in fertilizer costs and environmental impact

Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: How do I generate a fertigation schedule in the app?
A: To generate a fertigation schedule, follow these steps:

    1. Go to "My Farm"
    2. Select "Fertigation"
    3. Tap "Create Report"
    4. Fill in all the required details
    5. Save the report
    If you have soil, leaf, or petiole test data, you can input this for a more customized schedule. Otherwise, we can generate a basic schedule using general crop and regional data.

Q: If I don't add any test data, what is the basis for the generated fertigation schedule?
A: When no specific test data is provided, Fyllo generates a basic fertigation schedule based on:

    1. Typical nutrient needs for your crop type
    2. General soil characteristics common in your region
    3. Standard growing practices for your area
    This schedule provides a starting point, but may not be as precise as one based on specific test data.

messages.content:
तुमच्या बाणानाच्या पिकासाठी ठिबक सिंचन एक उत्तम पर्याय आहे, विशेषतः गुजरात आणि मध्यप्रदेशात. ठिबक सिंचनामुळे पाण्याचा वापर कमी होतो आणि पिकांना आवश्यक पाण्याची योग्य प्रमाणात उपलब्धता होते. 

जर तुम्हाला ठिबक सिंचनाच्या सेटिंग्ज किंवा पाण्याच्या आवश्यकतेबद्दल अधिक माहिती हवी असेल, तर कृपया मला सांगा.
messages.en:
Drip irrigation is a great option for your banyan crop, especially in Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh. Drip irrigation reduces water use and ensures proper availability of water required by crops. 

If you would like more information about drip irrigation settings or water requirements, please let me know.

messages.content: आम्ही कोणते ठिबक सिंचन निवडू
messages.en: Which drip irrigation will we choose?
messages.standalone_question: Which drip irrigation system should we choose?
messages.standalone_en: Which drip irrigation system should we choose?

messages.content:
तुमच्या बाणानाच्या पिकासाठी ठिबक सिंचन निवडताना, खालील गोष्टींचा विचार करा:

1. **सिंचनाची पद्धत**: ठिबक सिंचनाची पद्धत निवडा जी तुमच्या क्षेत्रातील पाण्याच्या उपलब्धतेनुसार आणि पिकाच्या गरजेनुसार योग्य असेल.

2. **ड्रिपर अंतर**: ड्रिपरचे अंतर ठरवा, जे तुमच्या पिकाच्या वाढीच्या टप्प्यानुसार असावे.

3. **ड्रिपर डिस्चार्ज**: ड्रिपरचा डिस्चार्ज दर ठरवा, जो पिकाच्या पाण्याच्या गरजेनुसार असावा.

4. **मातीची प्रकार**: तुमच्या मातीचा प्रकार (जसे की लोम, चिकणमाती) यावरून सिंचनाची पद्धत ठरवा.

5. **पाण्याची उपलब्धता**: पाण्याची उपलब्धता आणि स्थानिक हवामान यांचा विचार करा.

जर तुम्हाला ठिबक सिंचनाच्या सेटिंग्ज किंवा इतर तपशीलांबद्दल अधिक माहिती हवी असेल, तर कृपया मला सांगा.
messages.en:
When choosing drip irrigation for your banyan crop, consider the following:

1. Method of Irrigation**: Choose the method of drip irrigation which will be suitable according to the availability of water in your area and the needs of the crop.

2. **Driper Distance**: Determine the distance of the driper, which should be according to the stage of growth of your crop.

3. **Dripper discharge**: Determine the discharge rate of the dripper, which should be according to the water requirement of the crop.

4. **Soil type**: Determine the method of irrigation based on the type of soil (such as loam, clay).

5. **Water availability**: Consider water availability and local climate.

If you would like more information about drip irrigation settings or other details, please let me know.

messages.content:
तुमच्या बाणानाच्या पिकासाठी ठिबक सिंचन दोन्ही राज्यांमध्ये, मध्यप्रदेश आणि गुजरातमध्ये, प्रभावी आहे. दोन्ही ठिकाणी पाण्याची कमी उपलब्धता असू शकते, त्यामुळे ठिबक सिंचन पद्धत वापरल्यास पाण्याचा अधिक कार्यक्षम वापर होतो.

तुमच्या स्थानिक परिस्थिती, मातीचा प्रकार, आणि पिकाच्या गरजेनुसार योग्य ठिबक सिंचन पद्धत निवडणे महत्त्वाचे आहे. जर तुम्हाला अधिक माहिती हवी असेल, तर कृपया सांगा.
messages.en:
Drip irrigation for your banyan crop is effective in both states, Madhya Pradesh and Gujarat. There may be less availability of water in both places, so using drip irrigation method leads to more efficient use of water.

It is important to choose the right drip irrigation method according to your local conditions, soil type, and crop needs. If you need more information, please let me know.

messages.en:
If your device hasn't calibrated yet, there are a few things you may need to check:

1. **Water availability**: Is the reading of the sensor decreasing when water is poured on it? If not, check if the water supply is correct.

2. **Position of the sensor**: Is the sensor properly installed? Can water be stored in the soil around it?

3. **Drip System**: Are there any bottlenecks in the drip system? Are drippers at the right distance?

If you're still having a problem, would you like to open a ticket?

tools:
get_soil_moisture_sensor_depth  
Returns the depths in inches of the soil moisture sensors 1 and 2 installed on the plots.
faq:
Q: I irrigated still the sensor is dropping slowly.
A: Sometimes, the water reaches slowly till root zone and the moisture sensor kPa value drops slowly. Always wait for 12 hours after irrigation for the moisture to saturate. If still some confusion, ask user to check moisture near the sensor and check if he wants to raise a ticket for the issue.

Q: Sensor is showing wet, i.e. less kpa but soil looks dry.
A: The sensor measures the moisture around the rootzone which is not visible from the top. Ask use to check the moisture in rootzone around the sensor. If it matches, ask the user to irrigate.

Q: Sensor is showing dry, but it rained recently.
A: Rainwater doesn't percolate well in the soil. Most of it runs off. After a day of rain stops , if the sensor is still dry, you will have to irrigate. You can check the moisture by digging near the sensor . Irrigate accordingly.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor values fluctuate?
A: Ensure the sensor is installed properly in the soil, check for air bubbles, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

Q: The moisture (kpa) is increasing slowly recently.
A: Need to check for current stage and evapotranspiration rate. If the crop is recently sown or pruning (छंटाई)  is done recently, the transpiration will be slow and moisture kpa will increase slowly. If evaporation is slow or temperature have dropped on rainfall has happened, it will increase slowly. The chatbot needs to check the temperature , rainfall and crop stage data. And advise if there is any reason for the slow increase.
If still there is some confusion, the chatbot needs to ask user to check moisture around the sensor by digging and then ask  the user if he wants to create an issue ticket for the same.

या आठवड्यात, म्हणजे 6 जुलै 2025 रोजी, आपल्या "बनाना" पिकाच्या "ग्रँड ग्रोथ" टप्प्यात (आठवडा 12) खालील खते सोडण्याची आवश्यकता आहे:

- **युरिया**: 10 ग्रॅम/प्लांट
- **व्हाइट म्युरिएट ऑफ पोटाश**: 10 ग्रॅम/प्लांट

तुम्ही या खते पाण्यात मिसळून फर्टिगेशनद्वारे वापरू शकता. 

तुमच्या पुढील फर्टिगेशनची वेळ 19 जुलै 2025 रोजी "बूटिंग" टप्प्यात असेल, ज्यामध्ये काही विशेष सूचना देखील आहेत.
messages.en:
This week, i.e. on July 6, 2025, the following fertilizers need to be released during the "grand growth" phase of your "banana" crop (week 12):

- **Urea**: 10 g/plant
- **White Murriate of Potash**: 10 g/plant

You can mix these fertilizers with water and use them through fertigation. 

Your next fertigation time will be in the "booting" phase on July 19, 2025, with some special instructions.

messages.content: एकूण केळीचे 2900 झाडे आहेत
messages.en: There are a total of 2900 banana trees
messages.standalone_question: How many banana plants are there in total?
messages.standalone_en: How many banana plants are there in total?

messages.content:
आपल्या "बनाना" पिकासाठी, 2900 झाडांसाठी खते सोडण्याची गणना खालीलप्रमाणे आहे:

- **युरिया**: 10 ग्रॅम/झाड × 2900 झाडे = 29,000 ग्रॅम (29 किलोग्राम)
- **व्हाइट म्युरिएट ऑफ पोटाश**: 10 ग्रॅम/झाड × 2900 झाडे = 29,000 ग्रॅम (29 किलोग्राम)

तुम्ही या खते पाण्यात मिसळून फर्टिगेशनद्वारे वापरू शकता.
messages.en:
For your "banana" crop, the fertilizer release count for 2900 trees is as follows:

- **urea**: 10 g/tree × 2900 trees = 29,000 g (29 kg)
- **White Murriate of Potash**: 10 g/tree × 2900 trees = 29,000 g (29 kg)

You can mix these fertilizers with water and use them through fertigation.
